(ê±°ì˜ ëª¨ë“ ì´ë¼ê³  ê¸°ë¡í•œ ì´ìœ ëŠ” ì„¸ë¶€ ëª…ë ¹ì–´ì— ë”°ë¼ cloneë˜ëŠ” ë‚´ìš©ì´ ë‹¬ë¼ì§€ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì´ë‹¤.) ë˜í•œ cloneí•œ ì›ë³¸ repositoryì˜ remoteê°€ originìœ¼ë¡œ ìë™ ì„¤ì •ëœë‹¤. ë§Œì•½ ê¶Œí•œì´ ì—†ë‹¤ë©´ original repositoryì˜ ë¡œê·¸ë¥¼ ë³´ì§€ ëª»í•˜ë©°, í•´ë‹¹ ì €ì¥ì†Œë¡œ push í•˜ì§€ ëª»í•œë‹¤. â€‹ í•˜ì§€ë§Œ! ë¡œê·¸ê¹Œì§€ë„ ëª¨ë‘ cloneí•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ” ë“±ì˜ ëª‡ê°€ì§€ ëª…ë ¹ì–´ê°€ ì¡´ì¬í•œë‹¤. ê·¸ì¤‘ bareì™€ mirrorì— ëŒ€í•˜ì—¬ ì •ë¦¬í•œë‹¤. â€“bare ê³µì‹ë¬¸ì„œì˜ ì„¤ëª…ì€ ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ë‹¤. Make a bare Git repository. That is, instead of creating <directory> and placing the administrative files in <directory>/.git, make the <directory> itself the $GIT_DIR. This obviously implies the --no-checkout because there is nowhere to check out the working tree. Also the branch heads at the remote are copied directly to corresponding local branch heads, without mapping them to refs/remotes/origin/. When this option is used, neither remote-tracking branches nor the related configuration variables are created. ê°„ë‹¨íˆ bareì˜µì…˜ì€ HEADì˜ refs ì •ë³´ê°€ cloneëœë‹¤. *HEAD: í˜„ì¬ ì‘ì—…ì¤‘ì¸ ë¸Œëœì¹˜ _*refs: ì•Œì•„ë³´ê¸° ì‰¬ìš´ ì´ë¦„ìœ¼ë¡œ ì„¤ì •ëœ commit ì´ë¦„_ì„ â€œReferencesâ€ ë˜ëŠ” â€œRefsâ€ ë¼ê³  ë¶€ë¥¸ë‹¤. â€‹ â€“mirror ê³µì‹ë¬¸ì„œì˜ ì„¤ëª…ì€ ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ë‹¤. Set up a mirror of the source repository. This implies --bare. Compared to --bare, --mirror not only maps local branches of the source to local branches of the target, it maps all refs (including remote-tracking branches, notes etc.) and sets up a refspec configuration such that all these refs are overwritten by a git remote update in the target repository. ê°„ë‹¨íˆ mirrorì˜µì…˜ì€ ëª¨ë“  ë¸Œëœì¹˜ì˜ refs ì •ë³´ê°€ cloneëœë‹¤. â€‹ â€‹ âœ¨Point # forkì™€ cloneì˜ ì°¨ì´ ì›ë³¸ ì €ì¥ì†Œì™€ ì—°ê²°ì´ ë˜ì–´ ìˆëƒ(fork) ì•„ë‹ˆëƒ(clone)? â€‹ *Push Option â€“mirror Instead of naming each ref to push, specifies that all refs under refs/ (which includes but is not limited to refs/heads/, refs/remotes/, and refs/tags/) be mirrored to the remote repository. Newly created local refs will be pushed to the remote end, locally updated refs will be force updated on the remote end, and deleted refs will be removed from the remote end. This is the default if the configuration option remote.<remote>.mirror is set.
